      This function sets the db connection to null, therby closing the connection.

      This function updates the database by deleting all of the records in a specific table.If the rows were deleted successfully, the function returns true and false if not.

      This function is used to retrieve data from a single field in a table.

      This function opens the database connection between java and microsoft access.

      This function passes an SQL statement to the database and creates an internal record set that can be accessed by the getField() function

    • Method Detail

      • addRecord

        boolean addRecord(java.lang.String strTable,
                java.lang.String strKeyName,
                java.lang.String strKeyContents)
        This function adds a record to the specified table using the specified key. It returns true if the record was added and false if not.
        Parameters:
        strTable - a string representing the name of the table in the database
        strKeyName - a string representing the name of the key field in the table
        strKeyContents - a string representing the contents to be placed in the key field
        Returns:
        blnStatus a boolean flag representing whether or not the record was added

      • close

        void close()
        This function sets the db connection to null, therby closing the connection. This function is necessary for other users to access the database without problems
        Parameters:
        none -

      • deleteAll

        boolean deleteAll(java.lang.String strTable)
        This function updates the database by deleting all of the records in a specific table.If the rows were deleted successfully, the function returns true and false if not.
        Parameters:
        strTable - a string representing the name of the table in the database
        Returns:
        flag a boolean flag representing whether or not the records were deleted

      • getField

        java.lang.String getField(java.lang.String strFieldName)
        This function is used to retrieve data from a single field in a table. It is used in conjunction with the query function to desplay the database table field contents to the user.
        Parameters:
        strFieldName - a string representing the name of a field to be displayed
        Returns:
        strRet a string representing the contents of the specified field

      • moreRecords

        boolean moreRecords()
        This function is used to tell if a result set has more records. It returns true if there are more records, and false if not.
        Parameters:
        none -
        Returns:
        blnRet a boolean flag representing whether or not there are more records

      • openConnection

        void openConnection(java.lang.String strDataSourceName)
        This function opens the database connection between java and microsoft access.
        Parameters:
        strDataSourceName - a string the ODBC name you gave the operating system under administrative tools

      • query

        void query(java.lang.String strSQL)
        This function passes an SQL statement to the database and creates an internal record set that can be accessed by the getField() function
        Parameters:
        strSQL - a string representing a valid SQL statement

      • setField

        boolean setField(java.lang.String strTable,
               java.lang.String strKeyName,
               java.lang.String strKeyContents,
               java.lang.String strFieldName,
               java.lang.String strFieldContents)
        This function updates a single field in the database table with the specified contents. It returns true the field was added, and false if not.
        Parameters:
        strTable - a string representing the database table name
        strKeyName - a string representing key field name
        strKeyContents - a string representing key field contents
        strFieldName - a string representing the field name to be updated
        strFieldContents - a string representing the contents to be added to the field name
        Returns:
        returnFlag a boolean flag telling whethere the update was successful or not

      • status

        void status(java.lang.String strVar)
        This function simply returns a message using System.out.println() for use in testing
        Parameters:
        strVar - a string representing the words you want displayed to the user
